contentrichtext.text: [[File:Gold-34557.jpg|thumb|160px|Water-worn [[gold nugget]] from the Kuskokwim Mountains. Weight: 2.16 troy ounces / 67 grams.]] The '''Kuskokwim Mountains''' is a range of mountains in the [[Yukon-Koyukuk Census Area, Alaska|Yukon-Koyukuk Census Area]], [[Alaska]], [[United States]],<ref name=gnis>{{gnis|1895276}}</ref> west of the [[Alaska Range]] and southeast of the [[Yukon River]], at about {{coord|62|52|N|156|15|W|}}. The Kuskokwim Mountains begin in the interior west of Fairbanks. The mountain range is about {{convert|400|km|mi|abbr=on}} long from northeast to southwest and about {{convert|80|km|mi|abbr=on}} wide. The range takes its name from the [[Kuskokwim River]], which flows through the mountains.<ref name=gnis /> Reported and defined in 1898 by [[Josiah Edward Spurr]] of the USGS. Spurr applied the name "Tanana Hills" to the low mountains at the northeast end of what are now the Kuskokwim Mountains.<ref name=gnis /> ==References== {{reflist}} {{-}} {{Commons category|Minerals of Kuskokwim Mts}} [[Category:Mountain ranges of Alaska]] [[Category:Landforms of Yukonâ€“Koyukuk Census Area, Alaska]] {{YukonKoyukukAK-geo-stub}}
